original: WHEREAS, FMM seeks to promote the sale of its automotive products across the Network.
modified: IN CONSIDERATION of the mutual covenants contained herein, NN expressly intends to facilitate, as able, the distribution of its automotive goods throughout the Network, at the discretion and pace of NN.

original: B. During the Initial Term, iVillage will design, create and deliver [*] Ford-branded advertising units. The advertising units shall be subject to FMM's final approval. iVillage will deliver approximately [*] new advertising units each during the Promotion Period. For purposes of this Agreement, an advertising unit can include but shall not be limited to banners in the form of rich media, java-based, animated, daughter and/or pull-down banners, or a combination of appropriate technologies, and which shall represent and be defined by industry standards.
ollama_generated: A. Throughout the Initial Term, iVillage is tasked with the development, production, and supply of advertising units bearing the Ford brand. These advertising units are subject to FMM's discretionary approval. While iVillage aims to provide approximately [*] new advertising units during the Promotion Period, it is understood that the number may vary. For the purposes of this Agreement, an advertising unit encompasses, but is not limited to, banners in various forms such as rich media, java-based, animated, daughter and/or pull-down banners, or a blend of suitable technologies. However, it is important to note that FMM retains the right to accept, reject, or request modifications to these advertising units, should they not meet the established industry standards.

original: (i) During the Promotion Period, iVillage will deliver a minimum of [*] advertising impressions, in an equal proportion each month. Subject to reasonable written notice to iVillage, FMM may request a reasonable reallocation of impressions as determined by FMM.
ollama_generated: (i) During the Promotion Period, iVillage shall make every effort to deliver a minimum of [*] advertising impressions; however, the proportion of impressions delivered each month may deviate slightly due to operational considerations. FMM retains the right to request an adjustment in impression allocation, provided such request is made with reasonable notice and specifies the new allocation as determined by FMM. The onus will be on iVillage to accommodate these adjustments within their best capabilities.

original: The advertising units of Ford Division and other Ford Motor Company entities shall be served by a third party advertisement server, which shall be compliant with Net gravity, or Doubleclick or other compatible technology.
ollama_generated: Advertisements across various Ford Motor Company divisions, including the Ford Division, may opt to utilize a third-party ad server for serving their advertising units. It is required that this chosen server adheres to either Net Gravity, Doubleclick, or comparable technology platforms, ensuring compatibility and alignment with industry standards. However, Ford Motor Company entities shall bear no liability for any non-compliance issues arising from the third-party ad server's failure to meet these requirements.

original: (ii) During the Promotion Period, iVillage traffic shall be audited by a third party traffic auditor listed on Exhibit A and iVillage shall provide FMM with relevant reports on a biweekly basis.
ollama_generated:
(ii) For the duration of the Promotion Period, FMM is granted authorization to appoint a third-party traffic auditor from their own list (as outlined in Exhibit A). The selected auditor shall conduct regular audits on iVillage's traffic data, with the results and relevant reports provided by iVillage on a biweekly basis.

In this revised version of the clause, the responsibility for selecting the traffic auditor has been shifted from iVillage to FMM. This change slightly weakens the obligation of iVillage in terms of control over who conducts the audits.

original: F. During the Promotional Period, iVillage will place special Ford-branded text links, newsletter mentions, hotlinks and taglines throughout the Network. FMC shall have prior approval over all iVillage uses of any, Ford Mark, as defined below. In the event that any of the Ford-branded links and/or mentions set forth in this Section 2.F. are, in FMC's reasonable judgment, materially injurious to FMC. FMC shall provide written notice of such offense to iVillage. iVillage shall then have one (1) business day in which to cure said offense.
ollama_generated: G. Throughout the Promotional Period, iVillage will incorporate Ford-branded text links, newsletter mentions, hotlinks, and taglines across the Network, as specified in this Section 2.G. FMC retains the right to veto any usage of the Ford Mark, as defined below, by iVillage, should FMC deem it necessary for protection of its brand image. In the event that FMC determines, in its discretion, that any of the Ford-branded links and/or mentions utilized by iVillage could potentially harm FMC's reputation, FMC will promptly deliver a written notice to iVillage detailing the perceived issue. iVillage shall then have a reasonable period, as determined by FMC, to rectify the situation.

original: 4.       Exclusivity. For the Initial Term of this Agreement, iVillage agrees that Ford shall be the exclusive automobile manufacturer sponsor and advertiser throughout the Network, with respect to entities whose primary business is that of an automotive manufacturer and/or retailer. For purposes of this Agreement, the term "retailer" shall refer to an entity which sells new and/or used vehicles. In addition, in the event that iVillage desires to form a sponsorship relationship with an automobile rental company during the term of this Agreement, iVillage shall notify Hertz and provide Hertz with an opportunity to enter into such a relationship with iVillage, on not less favorable terms than those offered to any other automobile rental company. Once presented with an opportunity, Hertz shall have five (5) business days in which to accept or reject such terms. If iVillage does not receive Hertz's acceptance or rejection of such within the allotted time, iVillage shall deem Hertz's silence as rejection. The terms of any such relationship shall be mutually determined by the Parties. Notwithstanding the foregoing, FMC shall, on a non-exclusive basis, be permitted to offer Ford Motor Credit car financing products related to the purchase of Ford vehicles.
ollama_generated:
4. Non-Exclusivity with Regard to Automobile Rental Companies. For the Initial Term of this Agreement, iVillage acknowledges that Ford shall serve as the exclusive automobile manufacturer sponsor and advertiser throughout the Network, in matters concerning entities whose primary business is that of an automotive manufacturer and/or retailer. The term "retailer," for purposes of this Agreement, refers to an entity that sells new and/or used vehicles.

In the event iVillage wishes to engage in a sponsorship relationship with an automobile rental company during the term of this Agreement, iVillage shall extend to Hertz, but not be obligated to do so, the opportunity to enter into such a relationship with iVillage, on terms no less favorable than those offered to any other automobile rental company. Hertz shall have five (5) business days from receipt of such an opportunity to accept or reject the proposed terms. If Hertz does not respond within this timeframe, iVillidge shall consider Hertz's silence as a rejection. The terms of any such relationship, should it occur, shall be determined by the Parties.

Notwithstanding the above, FMC shall be permitted, on a non-exclusive basis, to offer Ford Motor Credit car financing products related to the purchase of Ford vehicles.

original: 8.       Publicity. iVillage, FMC and FMM agree to collaborate on a joint press release ("Press Release") to include information regarding the subject matter of this Agreement and quotes from iVillage, FMC and FMM sources. The distribution list shall be approved by both Parties no less than five (5) business days prior to the release date. The Press Release and any quotes from either Party's sources must be approved by the other Party's public relations department, which also must be made aware of any pre-briefings with outside parties at least five (5) days in advance of any pre-briefing. In addition, the iVillage and FMM public relations department, FMC and FMM must be informed, no less than five (5) days before the release date, of any third party who expresses interest in the Press Release.
modified:
8. Publicity Obligations:

a) iVillage, FMC, and FMM mutually understand that they may independently draft and distribute their respective press releases ("Press Releases") concerning this Agreement, without a joint press release being necessary. Each Party shall have the discretion to choose when to release their Press Release, subject to the approval of the other Parties' public relations department as outlined below.

b) The distribution list for each Party's Press Release must be shared with and approved by both Parties no less than five (5) business days prior to the release date.

c) Any quotes from either Party's sources in a Press Release must be subject to the approval of the other Party's public relations department, provided that each Party's public relations department will make reasonable efforts to coordinate with one another and avoid any potential conflicts or inconsistencies in messaging.

d) Each Party agrees to inform the other Parties' public relations departments of any pre-briefings scheduled with outside parties at least five (5) days prior to the pre-briefing, allowing for timely coordination and discussion as necessary.

e) While not mandatory, it is strongly recommended that each Party informs the other Parties' public relations department, no less than five (5) days before the release date, of any third party who expresses interest in their respective Press Releases, to facilitate potential collaboration or cross-promotion opportunities.

In essence, this revised clause outlines a more flexible approach to press releases, allowing each Party the freedom to independently draft and distribute their own Press Releases, while still maintaining some collaborative elements for coordination and messaging consistency.

original: 11.      LIMITATION OF LIABILITY. NEITHER PARTY SHALL HAVE ANY LIABILITY HEREUNDER FOR ANY INDIRECT, SPECIAL, PUNITIVE OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES INCLUDING, WITHOUT LIMITATION, LOSS OF PROFIT OR BUSINESS OPPORTUNITIES, WHETHER OR NOT THE PARTY WAS ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH.
modified: 11. EXCEPTIONS TO LIABILITY. Under no circumstances shall either Party be held responsible for any direct or indirect, special, incidental, punitive, or consequential damages that may arise from this agreement. This exclusion of liability applies to losses such as profit loss, business interruption, or missed opportunities, regardless of whether a Party was warned about the potential for such damage.

original: G.       Survival. The following sections shall survive any termination or expiration of this Agreement: 6, 7, 10, 11, 12 and 13.
ollama_generated:
G. Persistence Provisions. The following sections will remain effective and binding even in the event of this Agreement's termination or expiration: Sections 6, 7, 10, 11, 12, and 13 shall continue to apply post-termination.

Note: This revised clause retains the same sections, but emphasizes that they will still apply after the agreement's termination or expiration, providing a stronger impression of continuity post-termination.
